chapters.title: Why This Book
chapters.subtitle: When Code Is No Longer the Bottleneck
chapters.excerpt: I am writing this book because I believe we have reached the end of a long chapter in the history of software development — and the beginning of another for which we do not yet have a playbook.

chapters.title: Why software work broke after 2020
chapters.subtitle: The Fundamental Shift in Software Development
chapters.excerpt: Something fundamental shifted in how software gets built. The old playbook—more engineers, better processes, clearer requirements—stopped working. Understanding this shift is crucial for every engineering leader.

chapters.title: Why 'more engineers' no longer means 'more output'
chapters.subtitle: The Broken Scaling Relationship
chapters.excerpt: For decades, the answer to slow delivery was simple: hire more engineers. That linear relationship between headcount and output has broken down. Here's why, and what works instead.
